quest.name: The Next Ship to Sail
journal: Alphinaud is feeling the need to take stock.

Alphinaud calls the Scions to a meeting in Dawn's Respite that they might review what they know of the Telophoroi and their ominous towers. Events in Garlemald reinforce their suspicions that the onslaught of lunar primals is only a precursor to a far more deadly crisis─a crisis which must be stopped at any cost. As you ponder your options, Tataru interrupts the gathering to bring word from Krile that you may now journey unto Sharlayan, as well as instructions to make all haste to the docks in Limsa Lominsa.

After an emotional farewell, you board the ship bound for Sharlayan. At sea you are greeted by a most unexpected visitor, Hydaelyn, who confirms some of what you know, and hints at more that you do not. Her weighty words still echo in your mind as the famous city of scholars appears on the horizon...

Your entry into Sharlayan is not as smooth as you had hoped, but the timely arrival of Krile and her convincing arguments is enough to assuage the immigration officer's suspicions. Nevertheless, you deem it wise to move some distance away from the bureaucrat before you discuss the delicate matters at hand.
Krile expresses relief at your safe arrival, and bids you take a moment to regain your land legs. If you are to embark on a quest for answers, you must mind your step on the treacherous path ahead...
objectives: Speak with Tataru in Limsa Lominsa.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Forename, do you have some time to talk?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: I would like to gather everyone in Dawn's Respite and together assess the situation in which we find ourselves...

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Let us take stock of the facts, shall we? The crisis at hand began with the sudden appearance of ominous towers in a multitude of locations throughout the world.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: We have since learned that said structures were brought into being by an organization known as the “Telophoroi.”

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: The Telophoroi's stated purpose is to recreate the Final Days of eons past, an apocalyptic event that would result in the destruction of all we hold dear. Already have these towers of theirs been the cause of untold suffering.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Countless innocents kidnapped and imprisoned, their faith perverted for primal summonings...

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: And unless we find a way to deal with the corruptive aura surrounding the spires, we can't even get close enough to rescue anyone.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Those shielded with the blessing of Light seem able to resist being tempered, at least.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: But after what happened to Arenvald and Fordola, we need to be very, very careful about how we proceed...

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Yet while these threats close to home are of paramount concern, we mustn't lose sight of the situation in Garlemald.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: As you know, the Telophoroi are under the leadership of Fandaniel and one other delightful fellow: Zenos yae Galvus, the crown prince and our dear friend.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: To date, he's reclaimed his old body, murdered Emperor Varis, and plunged Garlemald into an even deeper pit of chaos.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: The capital has probably seen the worst of it. For a good while there, it saw the bloodiest fighting in the war of succession. But that has since changed─and in troubling ways...

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Aye, during our reconnaissance, the air was not once rent by the barking of cannons or the cries of discord. 'Twas an eerie fog of silence which did blanket that ruined city.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: The inhabitants appeared to have been tempered, and with nary a word spoken did they labor to transform the palace into a soaring edifice born of nightmares.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: If they were indeed made thralls, it seems safe to assume that these events, too, were orchestrated by the Telophoroi.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: An army of primals is awful enough, but in light of recent developments, I fear it is only the prelude to an even greater catastrophe.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: We need to devise a means to counter this threat, and quickly, before our allies are overwhelmed.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: We will find a way in Sharlayan, I am sure of it.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Master Fourchenault's comments regarding the Final Days were curious to say the least. The Forum knows more than it is letting on...

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: Sorry to interrupt!

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: We've just received word from Mistress Krile! She says that arrangements for your visit have been finalized.

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: You're to head to Limsa Lominsa and board the next ship bound for Sharlayan...

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: And on arrival, present yourselves as “associates of the Students of Baldesion,” come to assist with the order's restoration.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: The arrangements may be settled, but what of your thoughts? They must race at the prospect of returning home after so long.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: ...I am eager to see it, of course. Of course... Ahem. We should set off at once!

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: Then I'll accompany you to the docks. You need at least one person there to wave and cry and wish you a safe journey!

dialogue.name: EPHEMIE
dialogue.text: Safe journeys! And please, do be careful!

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Though a part of me looks forward to returning home, I've not forgotten that my father stripped us of the privileges of our family name. I hope it doesn't cause trouble with the officials upon our arrival...

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: What a grim reason to bring you to Sharlayan. Not much to be done about it, I suppose, but I would've liked to give you the grand tour under happier circumstances.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Contrary to what you might think, this will be like going home for me as well. I may have learned how to survive in Limsa Lominsa, but it was in Sharlayan where I was taught─quite relentlessly, I might add─the skills to properly live.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: I shudder to think what manner of truth awaiteth us beyond the Indigo Deep. Still more do I dread the prospect of discussions long overdue...

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: I might have lived in Master Matoya's cave for a good part of my life, but even for me, the thought of “returning” to Sharlayan is quite exciting. I can hardly imagine how it is for the others who lived most of their lives there.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: I never thought the day would come when I would be sailing home again. It always seemed so very far away...

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: Sea travel can be tedious, but I don't mind it. 'Tis a rare experience for most Ishgardians.

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: Everyone's here! Which is good, because I've already paid for your passage, and the fee is nonrefundable.

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: The ship for Sharlayan should be pulling into port soon, so please follow me and have all your luggage close at hand!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Continue with the main scenario quest?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: I'm fine. Honestly. Better to be waved through with a stern warning than be denied entry, after all.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: That was about as awkward as expected. Still, we're here now, and that's all that matters!

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Even allowing that the years I spent in the First passed here in the blink of an eye, the city feels untouched by time...

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Allow me to extend unto thee my warmest welcome, Forename. May the wisdom of my homeland aid us in our endeavors.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: You are doubtless eager to take in the sights. Not to worry, Forename─the city is not like to vanish before we finish our discussion.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Here we are at last─the great city of Sharlayan! You may have noticed some similarities with the Crystarium, yes? In fact, I─

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: ...Oh, but we really should let Krile have her say first. We can continue this conversation at another time.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: I am...unaccustomed to fabricating lies on demand. Why should it matter how I earn my living?

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: Wait, what are you still doing here!? Um, I think I can book you passage on the next ship...though I'll have to revise the budget. Again.

dialogue.name: Q2
dialogue.text: Travel to Old Sharlayan?

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: I'm glad I spotted your ship coming into port─the officers are born bureaucrats and sticklers for detail. In any case, you may relax and take a moment to get your land legs back!
